member.name: T:Tidy.AdventOfCode.Day`1
member.summary:
The base convenience class to inherit from when creating solutions for Advent of Code riddles.
Note that this class contains additional convenience subclasses for easily parsing the input value (e.g. to use default type conversion from strings and newline-splitting along the '\n' character).
You can and should create additional abstractions based on your needs from this class.
member.typeparam: The type of the data used when processing the input, looking for the correct solution. If using the default and service configuration, then the input is provided by the method to the property to be used in one of the executor methods.

member.name: T:Tidy.AdventOfCode.Day`1.Raw
member.summary: Uses no parsing of the input value. Simply provides the input string unmodified. See also .

member.name: M:Tidy.AdventOfCode.Day`1.Raw.ParseInput(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the input string.
member.param: The input to return.
member.returns: The unmodified.

member.name: T:Tidy.AdventOfCode.Day`1.NewLineSplitParsed
member.summary: Splits the input string along newlines ('\n') and uses for to convert using the method. See also .

member.name: M:Tidy.AdventOfCode.Day`1.NewLineSplitParsed.ParseInput(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the provided by splitting along the newline ('\n') character, and projecting each line to a type by using the default .
member.param: The raw input value.
member.returns: The parsed values as a generic array.

member.summary: Executes part 1 of the solution. By default, calls this method, and this throws a and either this or should be overridden.
member.returns: The answer to part 1 of the riddle, as computed.

member.summary: Executes part 2 of the solution. By default, calls this method, and this throws a and either this or should be overridden.
member.returns: The answer to part 2 of the riddle, as computed.

member.summary: Asynchronously executes part 1 of the solution. By default, this method calls , which throws a and either this or should be overridden.
member.returns: The answer to part 1 of the riddle, as computed asynchronously.

member.summary: Asynchronously executes part 2 of the solution. By default, this method calls , which throws a and either this or should be overridden.

member.name: T:Tidy.AdventOfCode.DayAttribute
member.summary: Used to annotate a non-conventionally named object with the corresponding year and day values, or ignore a subclass from being resolved by an . By convention, objects should be named Day# or Day##, where # and ## represents the day number, and be placed in a namespace which has a last segment of Year####, where #### corresponds to the relevant year.

member.summary: Annotate a type with the given and values when not conventionally named.
member.param: The relevant year for the type.
The relevant day for the type.

member.summary: The day number that the belongs to.

member.name: P:Tidy.AdventOfCode.DirectoryCacheManager.CookieValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the stored cookie value. The cookie should contain the cookie value for the key 'session', and should be placed in the directory provided by the instance named 'cookie.txt'. Consequent calls return a cached value, but setting the value updates the cache and stores the value in the text file.

member.summary: Get the base directory used for caching.

member.name: M:Tidy.AdventOfCode.DirectoryCacheManager.GetStableHash(System.String)
member.summary: Calculates a simple, repeatable hash for the given (an answer) that is used as part of naming the cached file entries. If the can be parsed as an , the number value is used. If the is not longer than 10 characters long, the string value itself is used. Otherwise, a default hash is calculated using , of which the first 10 characters are used.
member.param: The text to calculate the simple hash for.
member.returns: The repeatable hash for the input .

member.summary: Create a simple provider that returns the provided path in the property.
member.param: The path value to provide.

member.summary: The path value. Doesn't mutate once the provider is instantiated.

member.name: T:Tidy.AdventOfCode.ICachingApiHandler
member.summary: A handler responsible for getting the inputs from and posting the answers to https://adventofcode.com/ using the user's session cookie. Note that this handler uses local caching of the inputs and answers/results.

member.name: M:Tidy.AdventOfCode.ICachingApiHandler.GetInputAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get the input string value for the given and from the server. Note that input does not vary between the two parts of a riddle. If the input was already obtained, it will be returned from local file cache.
member.param: The relevant year.
The relevant day.
The token used for cancelling asynchronous requests.
member.returns: The input given for the and .

member.name: M:Tidy.AdventOfCode.ICachingApiHandler.PostAnswerAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get the result of a given answer to a riddle from the server. If the same answer was already posted, the result will be returned from local file cache. Note that this might interfere with correctly solving a riddle when multiple answers were posted in a short amount of time as AoC allows only one try per minute. In this case the warning result will be cached, and the cache might need to be cleared manually.
member.param: The relevant year.
The relevant day.
The relevant part.
The answer, which is normally provided on the UI in an input box.
The token used for cancelling asynchronous requests.
member.returns: The response HTML's content of the <main> tag.

member.name: T:Tidy.AdventOfCode.Runner
member.summary: The default runner for executing potential solutions for Advent of Code riddles. By default, uses caching of input, answer and response values and directly calls the server at the https://adventofcode.com/ website to get the inputs and post the answers to the riddles.

member.name: M:Tidy.AdventOfCode.Runner.#ctor(Tidy.AdventOfCode.IDayResolver,Tidy.AdventOfCode.ICachingApiHandler,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger{Tidy.AdventOfCode.Runner})
member.summary: Creates a runner to execute instances' methods, provide and parse the inputs, post the answers and log and store the result.
member.param: The resolver used to create instances.
The handler used to communicate with the server.
The logger used for logging.

member.name: M:Tidy.AdventOfCode.Runner.CreateDefault(System.String,System.Action{Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection},System.Reflection.Assembly[])
member.summary: Creates a default by creating a instance by configuring the extension with the supplied parameters and retrieving the instance from the provider.
member.param: This parameter is passed to the method.
An optional call to augment the created instance with custom services or overrides.
This parameter is passed to the method.
member.returns: The instance from the .

member.name: P:Tidy.AdventOfCode.Runner.DayResolver
member.summary: The resolver used to create instances.

member.name: P:Tidy.AdventOfCode.Runner.CachingApiHandler
member.summary: The handler used to communicate with the server.

member.name: P:Tidy.AdventOfCode.Runner.Logger
member.summary: The logger used for logging.

member.name: M:Tidy.AdventOfCode.Runner.ExecuteAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Executes the solution found in for , and . By default, a run consist of the following:
- creating an using ,
- getting the input value for the riddle (either from the server or API),
- parse the input using the method and store the result in the property,
- execute the method to get the answer to the riddle,
- post the answer to the server or retrieve it from cache (if it was already posted).
At all points, the method logs useful information (running times, the answer, the result) to the .
member.param: The riddle's corresponding year (between 2015 and the current year).
The riddle's corresponding day number (between 1 and 25).
The riddle's corresponding part (1 or 2).
The cancellation token to cancel any pending operations in case a cancellation (e.g. application exit) is requested.
member.returns: The result of posting the answer to the server.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions
member.summary: An extension to register the default implementations to a given .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddTidyAdventOfCode(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly[])
member.summary:
An extension to register the default implementations to a given .
The following steps are taken:
- console logging is added,
- the is registered an an ,
- the is registered as an , using the provided ,
- the is registered as an ,
- the given is used to register a as an ,
- the is registered as an ,
- the is registered for resolving for both and (technically it is for requesting as an ),
- a instance (as itself).
All instances are registered for lifetimes.
Any and all implementations can be switched out by registering the relevant service type after calling this method.
member.param: The to populate with services.
The directory path used for caching the cookie, inputs, answers and responses.
The assemblies to scan when looking for implementations beside the entry assembly.
member.returns: The collection for chaining.
